summary: This bill, the Removing Extraneous Loopholes Insuring Every Veteran Emergency Act (RELIEVE Act), aims to improve veterans' access to reimbursement for emergency medical treatment. It amends Title 38 of the United States Code to modify eligibility requirements for emergency care received through the Veterans Community Care program. Specifically, the bill removes the requirement for prior receipt of VA care for emergency treatment received within a 60-day window after enrollment. This amendment takes effect one year after the bill's enactment.
